markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 16"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Blank Slate](/Feats.aspx?ID=591) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rogue" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=139" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 188 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Legendary in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5)

</column>

---

Your deceptions confound even the most powerful mortal divinations. [Detection](/Traits.aspx?ID=43), [revelation](/Traits.aspx?ID=138), and [scrying](/Traits.aspx?ID=141) effects pass right over you, your possessions, and your auras, detecting nothing unless the detecting effect has a [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) level of 10 or higher. For example, [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66) would still detect other magic in the area but not any magic on you, [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) wouldn't reveal you, [_locate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=173) or [_scrying_](/Spells.aspx?ID=268) wouldn't find you, and so on.
name: Blank Slate

text: <title level="1" right="Feat 16" pfs="Standard" > Blank Slate Source Core Rulebook pg. 188 4.0 Prerequisites Legendary in Deception --- Your deceptions confound even the most powerful mortal divinations. Detection, revelation, and scrying effects pass right over you, your possessions, and your auras, detecting nothing unless the detecting effect has a counteract level of 10 or higher. For example, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area but not any magic on you, true seeing wouldn't reveal you, locate or scrying wouldn't find you, and so on.
